instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this lineâ€™s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message:
Hello every body

I m working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when charger plug.

I tried;

Pram reset
SMC Reset
Known good charger and battery
Replaced SMC and ISL
Replaced BIOS
Tried with no connected keyboard ,trackpad.

But nothing change , Shutdown computer normally when pluged charger runs on again.

No liquid damage

Any one have idea?

thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 within specification? Is the battery detected by OSX?
Does the system charge a battery?

<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>/81 within specification? Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> and SDA in Ohm?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message: Did you shutdown from inside OSX? Does it power on from battery alone?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message:
Hello there
Today I looked again at my computer sorry :(
Yes MacOS detect battery and turns on from battery. And you're right, Duke. When we turn off the system from MacOS, the computer does not turn on again when you unplug & plug in MagSafe. 

Energy setting is looking normal. Interesting problem:)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message: So what is the problem then? When you shut down from OSX is does not power on again when you connect charger now?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message:
Yes if i shut down form OS not power up again when connected Magsafe . But if I force shutdown by pressing power button, when i connected magsafe automatic start. What ever i send it :) 

Thanks for help every one

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on when plug magsafe
threads.message: I would call that good enough.
